pull.title: ci: increase CPU count of sanitizer job to increase memory limit
pull.body:
According to the [docs](https://cirrus-ci.org/guide/linux/#linux-containers):
> For each CPU you can't get more than 4G of memory.

thus if we want this job to have 24GB of memory, we need to increase the CPU count to 6.

It's currently [failing with](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/runs/2273962280):
>  Requested memory is too high! You can request at most 4G per CPU

events.message:
ci: increase CPU count of sanitizer job to increase memory limit

According to the docs,
https://cirrus-ci.org/guide/linux/#linux-containers, "For each CPU you
can't get more than 4G of memory.", thus if we want this job to have
24GB of memory, we need to increase the CPU count to 6.

events.body:
> ... if we want this job to have 24GB of memory, we need to increase the CPU count to 6.

... or use Compute Credits.
ACK if CI is happy with this

>  if CI is happy with this

CI seems to be happy enough to not insta-fail due to mis-configuration. The [failing job](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21609/checks?check_run_id=2274150365) (not modified here) has timed out after 2 hours:

> #12646	INITED cov: 19489 ft: 128011 corp: 3594/4992Kb exec/s: 49 rss: 835Mb
> #12646	DONE   cov: 19489 ft: 128011 corp: 3594/4992Kb lim: 598770 exec/s: 49 rss: 835Mb
> Done 12646 runs in 257 second(s)
> 
> Timed out!
Should we split up the fuzz job into two?

@sipa If we want to speed up the fuzz job another route could be to simply remove large inputs which don't contribute to increased coverage. I think many (all?) of the very large inputs were added to the qa-assets repo by mistake, not that they added coverage historically :)

See the open issue https://github.com/bitcoin-core/qa-assets/issues/56: "Consider removing unnecessarily large inputs which are causing excessive corpus processing runtime".

issue.title: Fuzzer build "Timed out!"
issue.body:
Fuzzer build `[no depends, sanitizers: fuzzer,address,undefined,integer] [focal]` seems to timing out on master:

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/runs/2294417904

Also one of my PRs:

https://cirrus-ci.com/task/5980404822835200?logs=ci#L4543

From the output it seems like it is succeeding it takes two hours and the output ends in:

```
Done 12648 runs in 255 second(s)
Timed out!
```

There was a comment a few days ago about a fuzzer time out but I'm not sure it's related
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21609#issuecomment-813817656
